content.question: Of the following series, which can be used with the comparison test to show that <math alttext="the sum from n equals 3 to infinity, of, the fraction the natural log of n, over n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mi>∞</mi></munderover></mstyle><mfrac><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>n</mi></mrow><mi>n</mi></mfrac></math> diverges?

choices.label: <math alttext="the sum from n equals 3 to infinity, of, the fraction 1 over n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mi>∞</mi></munderover></mstyle><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>n</mi></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the sum from n equals 3 to infinity, of, the fraction 1 over n times the square root of n, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mi>∞</mi></munderover></mstyle><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mi>n</mi><msqrt><mi>n</mi></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the sum from n equals 3 to infinity, of, the fraction 1 over n squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mi>∞</mi></munderover></mstyle><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msup><mi>n</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the sum from n equals 3 to infinity, of, the fraction 1 over n squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mi>∞</mi></munderover></mstyle><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>n</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the sum from n equals 3 to infinity, of, the fraction 1 over n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mi>∞</mi></munderover></mstyle><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>n</mi></mfrac></math>

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
